The code entered here will be used as the key to locate a record from the LC.ADVICE.TEXT file in order to retrieve the full name of a document (e.g. Bill of Lading), which is to be sent to either the Issuing Bank for Export/Advising L/C's, or the Applicant for Import/Opening L/C's, or the Collecting Bank an outward collection or the Drawee for an inward collection.

Contains all the override messages which the user agreed to during input of the Drawing. The field will be updated by the system and no operator input will be allowed.

During the validation of a Drawing contract, the system may provide the user with a series of screen override messages to indicate an anomaly, for instance, that there is no limit set up for the customer.
In the event that the user confirms the override, the full text of the actual override message will be stored, for reference purposes only, in this multivalue field.
For example, if the user inputs a deal, then when the Drawing is validated a warning bell will sound and a message will appear at the foot of the screen which reads :
'NO LIMIT DEFINED FOR CUSTOMER'
This will draw the users attention to the override entry(s). After checking and making any necessary amendments the user then approves the transaction.

Code specifying what type of drawing this is.
This code identifies which kind of Drawing is being made under the L/C, and will impact the kind of processing done. The following types can be entered for a new drawing:
AC - Acceptance (Usance credits) DP - Deferred Payment (Usance credits) SP - Sight Payment
The following types can only be entered as a change to an existing drawing:

For Drawing types of 'AC' and 'DP', a term or usance credit is established whereby the funds will be debited and paid on the MATURITY.REVIEW date specified later. If the funds are required to be paid before this date, the Drawing can be Discounted, whereby payment is made on the Value date specified, but reimbursement is obtained on the MATURITY.REVIEW date.
If 'SP' is entered, then both Payment and reimbursement is made on the VALUE.DATE specified.
2-2 type AAA (Alpha) characters.
Valid codes are: 'AC'; 'DP'; 'SP'. (Mandatory Input)

This is the rate quoted by the treasury department to the trade finance department (ie excluding department spread).
The department spread will be accepted in RATE.SPREAD field. The exchange rate including the rate spread will be customer debit rate and will be shown in DEBIT.CUST.RATE field.
The DEBIT.CUST.RATE will be applied between the document currency and the debit account currrency (DRAW.CURRENCY and DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT.CURRENCY) if they differ.
Default calculated from currency table, using current mid market spot rate.

This field contains the message class ID, (defined in EB.ADVICES). There may be many classes specified, but only classes which are related to the operation, will be triggered. For example, the EB.ADVICES number LC-3801 (L/C Export Sight Drawing) may have the following classes and messages:
Message No. : 1798
EB.MESSAG.CLASS : NOTIFICATION Message No. : 754
EB.MESSAG.CLASS : OPERATIONS Message No. : 742
EB.MESSAG.CLASS : REIMBURSING Assume that the EB.MESSAGE.CLASS ID has been mapped to L/C internal class specified in LC.PARAMETERS as follows:
BASIC.MESSAGE = OPERATIONS
NOTIFICATION = NOTIFICATION
REIMBURSING = REIMBURSING

In the L/C Transaction, the system will always populate the OPERATIONS and NOTIFICATION class when the L/C is issued. The REIMBURSING class will only be triggered, when THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO or THIRD.PARTY field (REIMBURSING bank in this case) in LETTER.OF.CREDIT has filled up. In combination with the field (SEND.MESSAGE), you can choose whether you want to produce the messages by flipping the YES/NO flag.

This System Generated field contains the activity number triggered by the program. The activity is a 4 digit number, which is composed of three main parts:
First digit stands for Operation
1 represents O or P operation in LETTER.OF.CREDIT
2 represents A, C or T operation in LETTER.OF.CREDIT
3 represents Sight Drawing Operation in DRAWINGS
4 represents Usance Drawing Operation in DRAWINGS
Second digit stands for Type of Instruments
1 - represents Outward Collection
2 - represents Inward Collection
4 - represents Export Letter of Credit
8 - represents Import Letter of Credit
And the last two digit stands for detail activity related to that operation.

e.g. For the L/C Export Sight Payment activity, the first digit will be 3. The second digit will be 4 and the last two digits will be 01 (to indicate basic INPUT/AUTHORIZE operation). Thus the activity for Export Sight Drawing will be LC-3401. For the complete list of activity code, please consult Users Manual.

Specifies the currency of the drawing.

Should the applicant / Beneficiary wish to effect reimbursement in a currency different to that of the drawing, the exchange rate input in the field RATE.BOOKED will be used to convert the DRAW.CURRENCY into DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT.CURRENCY. If no input is made in RATE.BOOKED, the foreign market exchange rate will be defaulted and the system will automatically convert the draw currency into that of the reimbursement currency (DRAWDOWN ACCOUNT.CURRENCY).
Also refer to help text of field RATE.SPREAD.
Mandatory Input
CCY (Currency code e.g. GBP must be 3 characters) - Default to LC.CURRENCY

In the event that both the drawdown account and payment account are different currencies to that of the drawing, the Foreign exchange rate applicable to the drawdown account currency and the DRAW.CURRENCY will be entered in RATE.BOOKED.

With regards to the payment account a seperate Foreign Exchange rate will be entered in TREASURY.RATE field with TREASURY.SPREAD. The rate entered here will be used between DRAW.CURRENCY and PAYMENT.ACCOUNT.CURRENCY.
Identifies the account where funds are to be paid to under this drawing.
The account which will be credited on either the value date or maturity review date, depending on drawing type, for the payment in respect of the drawing.

If the payment method entered above is either 'BP' (Bankers payment) or 'CH' (Cheque), then this field will be automatically updated by the system to indicate the account to be used. This will be set up on the LC.PARAMETERS file as 'B.P.ISSUED.ACC' and 'CHEQUES.ISSUE.ACC'.

For drawing types 'AC', 'DP', this account will be credited on the Maturity Review date in respect of payment, unless the drawing is being discounted, in which case it will be credited on the value date.
For drawing type 'SP', this account will be credited on the Value date in respect of payment.
For drawing type 'CO' with 'UNDER.RESERVE' set to 'YES', then this account will be credited on the value date.
1-16 Mnemonic characters relating to a Customer Account or a Nostro Account, or any other account. Default from Payment Method (see below).
Mandatory input for Drawing types 'AC', 'DP', 'SP', and 'CO' with UNDER.RESERVE set to 'YES'.
NOINPUT field automatically updated with status DELETED , when the drawings created in IHLD is deleted.
Identifies the account where funds are to be received from under this drawing.
The account which will be debited on either the value date or maturity review date, depending on drawing type, in reimbursement of funds paid to the beneficiary of the drawing.

If this field is not entered, then a default will be found from the parent L/C contract. For Import/Opening L/C's, this default will come from the APPLICANT.ACC field of the L/C. For Export/Advising L/C's, the default will come from the ISSUING.BANK.ACC field of the L/C. If these fields were not entered, and this drawing involves an actual payment, (i.e. drawing types 'AC', 'D',or 'SP'), then a mandatory input is required.
For drawing types 'AC', 'DP', this account will be debited on the Maturity Review date in respect of reimbursement.

For drawing type 'SP', this account will be debited on the Value date in respect of reimbursement. The currency of this account need not be the same as the currency of the drawing. If this is the case, the system will automatically calculate the amount to be debited (see RATE.BOOKED above).
1-16 Mnemonic characters relating to a Customer Account or a Nostro Account, or any other account. Default from L/C (see below). Mandatory input depending upon type.
Mandatory input for drawing types 'AC', 'DP', or 'SP'.
